ralgorithm

Interface Movement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectAll, ContractAll, CornerOneTunnel, Elevator, ExpandAll, ExpandedOneTunnel, FlipConfiguration, MakeTunnel, OneTunnel, Slide, Staircase

    public interface Movement
    Movement is a logical step of operations performable on a robot.

    Current valid Movements include:

    • Slide
    • kTunnel
    • OneTunnel
    Since:
    2/14/2016

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finalizeMove()
      Runs final cleanup to update robot, switch units in modules etc.
      Robot getRobot() 
      Movement invert(Robot s)
      Inverts a movement by doing to opposite (i.e.
      boolean reachedEnd()
      Determines is the Movement has completed all steps
      void step()
      Run a single step of the movement.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        void step()
        Run a single step of the movement.

        Number of steps is tracked in implementation

      • reachedEnd

        boolean reachedEnd()
        Determines is the Movement has completed all steps
        Returns:
        True if done

      • invert

        Movement invert(Robot s)
        Inverts a movement by doing to opposite (i.e. Slide in reverse Direction)
        Returns:
        a new Movement that is this inverted

      • finalizeMove

        void finalizeMove()
        Runs final cleanup to update robot, switch units in modules etc.

      • getRobot

        Robot getRobot()
        Returns:
        the robot associated with the movement
